posts.name: sanddrag
posts.cooked:
I figured I’d start a new thread dedicated help with all things 3DExperience Platform, primarily because I need help with it. I think this has the potential to be a great replacement for GrabCAD, but I’m getting a little hung up getting started.

I made it this far in the tutorial video . The trouble is, I can’t get the side bar plugin in Solidworks to look like this: image 785×1176 130 KB

image 785×1176 130 KB

image 785×1176 130 KB

All I’ve got is this (files are ones I added to 3DExperience Drive in WIndows Explorer). image 1514×1150 145 KB

image 1514×1150 145 KB

image 1514×1150 145 KB

I don’t see how to get my plugin to be like in the video.

Maybe I’m not understanding the difference between 3DSpace and 3DDrive. Can anyone explain that to me? Am I not using the right “app”?

When I click on anything in here: image 681×1705 124 KB

image 681×1705 124 KB

image 681×1705 124 KB

It launches a new tab in Chrome that comes up completely blank. Even going to this link http://solidworks.com/academic-cloud it comes up blank.

image 2150×981 29.9 KB

image 2150×981 29.9 KB

image 2150×981 29.9 KB

Oddly enough, 3DExperience in the browser works fine in an Incognito window.

Are my troubles because I accepted only the necessary cookies? Are my troubles because I am using Solidworks 2022-2023 and not 2023-2024? Is my 3DExperience account not set up with the right group or something?

@mplanchard or anyone else who has got this working, please help. I’m feeling rather lost on this.

link_counts.title: First time 3DExperience issues - help getting ability to use "CAD"

posts.cooked: I believe that you need the new version of solidworks, don’t quote me on that though. @OccamzRazor

posts.name: OccamzRazor
posts.cooked:
You should use the latest version of SOLIDWORKS with the platform to use the service window shown below -  but there is also a download you need to launch from the platform in your browser first and any time you want to connect to the cloud using PLM services (smaller image attached).

image 1908×1033 237 KB

image 1908×1033 237 KB

image 1908×1033 237 KB

image 466×918 83.6 KB

image 466×918 83.6 KB

image 466×918 83.6 KB

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked:
Thank you @OccamzRazor you are correct.  You need the SOLIDWORKS AddIn App from the Compass in a browser.

View Ryan’s webinar for FIRST teams https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y1GRvUoeLK8&t=146s

From your invitation you open a web browser.  Click the compass in the upper left - big blue circle.

From your invitation you open a web browser.  Click the compass in the upper left - big blue circle.

Create a Collaborative Space with the 3D Space Apps.  Use 1 Collaborative Space for your team.

Create a Collaborative Space with the 3D Space Apps.  Use 1 Collaborative Space for your team.

Select the SOLIDWORKS Add in from below the compass  - install the HotFix.  This should connect to SOLIDOWORKS 2022-2023.  But I strongly recommend you apply for sponsorship and get SOLIDWORKS 2023.

Select the SOLIDWORKS Add in from below the compass  - install the HotFix.  This should connect to SOLIDOWORKS 2022-2023.  But I strongly recommend you apply for sponsorship and get SOLIDWORKS 2023.

We also have a new FIRST Dashboard now that has Bookmark Editor and xDesign your cloud CAD.  The AndyMark and Rev Robotics and Lego Libraries are tabs across the top.

We also have a new FIRST Dashboard now that has Bookmark Editor and xDesign your cloud CAD.  The AndyMark and Rev Robotics and Lego Libraries are tabs across the top.

The SOLIDWORKS Add In allows you to go back and forth to SOLIDWORKS desktop and cloud storage.

The SOLIDWORKS Add In allows you to go back and forth to SOLIDWORKS desktop and cloud storage.

3D Drive is cloud storage for windows.  It works like google drive but knows about SOLIDWORKS associated file structure.

3D Drive is cloud storage for windows.  It works like google drive but knows about SOLIDWORKS associated file structure.

We recommend you use set your Collaborative Space for your team and use this space for everyone with Bookmarks.

We recommend you use set your Collaborative Space for your team and use this space for everyone with Bookmarks.

In the beginning - lets make certain your cloud apps work the the SOLIDWORKS Add In from your web browser.

In the beginning - lets make certain your cloud apps work the the SOLIDWORKS Add In from your web browser.

Then you will be able to login to the platform from WIndows and just go into SOLIDWORKS - but this will be better at 2023.

Then you will be able to login to the platform from WIndows and just go into SOLIDWORKS - but this will be better at 2023.

Start with a part of a small assembly inside of SOLIDWORKS and save to the cloud.

Start with a part of a small assembly inside of SOLIDWORKS and save to the cloud.

My husband David did a few simple examples to help out educators. 3DEXPERIENCE Works Lesson 1: Getting Started with SOLIDWORKS and the Platform

3DEXPERIENCE Works Lesson 2: SOLIDWORKS and Save and Revision

3DEXPERIENCE Works Lesson 3: SOLIDWORKS and Bookmarks, Share and Delete

3DEXPERIENCE Works Lesson 4: SOLIDWORKS and Lifecycle Maturity States

3DEXPERIENCE Works Lesson 5: SOLIDWORKS, Collaborative Space and Bookmarks FIRST Challenge 2 Dashboard 1920×1025 225 KB

FIRST Challenge 2 Dashboard 1920×1025 225 KB

FIRST Challenge 2 Dashboard 1920×1025 225 KB

posts.name: sanddrag
posts.cooked: Any idea why 3DExperience opens blank in my browser when I’m not in incognito mode? Maybe it’s a cookie thing?

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked: If it works in incognito then try cleaning out your cookies and cache.   If that does not work please go to go.3ds.com/studentcommunity and post the question.  There are support engineers that monitor this page.

posts.name: sanddrag
posts.cooked:
I’m really trying to make this work, but still struggling. I appreciate the help @mplanchard and I hope we’re able to get this sorted out. I’m days and hours invested into this now, so I don’t want to just abandon my efforts here.

I cleared all cache and cookies in Chrome, and 3DExperience still loads a blank page. I switched to Edge as my default browser, and the browser side of 3DExperience seems to work fine for me in Edge. So, I’ll stick with that.

I tried following Lesson 1 . Again, I didn’t get too far. I do not have the “Design with SOLIDWORKS” “app” in My Apps.

This is what I need (I think) image 1003×1032 133 KB

image 1003×1032 133 KB

image 1003×1032 133 KB

This is what I have image 931×1780 255 KB

image 931×1780 255 KB

image 931×1780 255 KB

Is the “SOLIDWORKS Add-in” the same thing as the “Design with Solidworks” App and it got a new name? Or are these two different things and I don’t have the right thing?

When I click on the SOLIDWORKS Add-In icon in 3DExperience in my browser, it launches Solidworks. That tells me the launcher is installed and working.

However, in Solidworks 2022-2023, my 3DExerience panel looks nothing like the tutorial.

This is what I have: image 676×846 32.5 KB

image 676×846 32.5 KB

image 676×846 32.5 KB

This is what I need: image 1536×1113 90 KB

image 1536×1113 90 KB

image 1536×1113 90 KB

It’s like my version of the hotfix is completely different or something. Is this 3DExperience Add-In something that just flat out does not work in Solidworks 2022-2023 and it’s mandatory to install SolidWorks 2023-2024? Or am I doing something wrong?

I use Solidworks professionally on a daily basis, but I’m struggling to get this 3DExperience add-in working correctly.

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked:
yes Design with SOLIDWORKS and the SOLIDWORKS app are the same.

I sent you the code for 2023 SOLIDWORKS for you and your FIRST team.  Uninstall 2022.  Install 2023 and then exit - reboot.

Create a Collaborative Space from your browser window (not inside of SOLIDWORKS).  Select 3DSpace App.

Click SOLIDWORKS App from your browser window.  This launches SOLIDWORKS desktop and the 3DEXPERIENCE Add Inn,

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked: Please remove any SOLIDWORKS 2022 or earlier and then install the new sponsorship of SOLIDWORKS 2023 desktop!  Very important.  For more technical support and questions go to go.3ds.com/studentcommunity and post your questions.

posts.name: sanddrag
posts.cooked: Thank you for the help Marie. This was my issue. 3DExperience seems to function as intended with SolidWorks 2023-2024,  but not with 2022-2023. I really appreciate your patience and support in helping to get me going on this.

posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked: I how do I submit a new excel file to add more students to my 3dexperience team?

posts.name: Garrett Wight
posts.cooked:
@mplanchard I feel like I’m finally getting the hang of the 3DExperience and SolidWorks integration. I’m having a weird issue with uploading and viewing the assemblies on the 3DE platform web viewer xDesign.

As far as I know, I’ve uploaded things correctly and tried to use bookmarks to simplify things. Why does my model not show? I figure it has to do with Step files not referencing correctly but I’m not sure why? image 1663×877 190 KB image 1885×873 130 KB

image 1663×877 190 KB

image 1663×877 190 KB

image 1885×873 130 KB

image 1885×873 130 KB

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked:
Wow! you have really done well.  Try a test.  Are you using the FIRST Champions Dashboard.  You should have this dashboard on your list of dashboards.  If you do not, please send an email to Support.3DSEdu@3ds.com and request the FIRST Champions Dashboard.

A test - save the STP file in SOLIDWORKS.  The import the file in xDesign - see when you save, if the component is displayed in a simple assembly.

Please propose your question to the Student Community.  There are many technical support engineers that monitor these questions to help FIRST teams.

https://go.3ds.com/studentcommunity

Inside the student community, there is a wiki with the most current 3DXML files of the kit of parts - might work better for you.  Please let me know, Regards, Marie FIRST FRC 2024 Champions Dashboard 1920×929 370 KB

FIRST FRC 2024 Champions Dashboard 1920×929 370 KB

FIRST FRC 2024 Champions Dashboard 1920×929 370 KB

posts.cooked:

I’m having a weird issue with uploading and viewing the assemblies on the 3DE platform web viewer xDesign.

As far as I know, I’ve uploaded things correctly and tried to use bookmarks to simplify things. Why does my model not show? I figure it has to do with Step files not referencing correctly but I’m not sure why?

posts.name: bohdand
posts.cooked:
Not sure this is the best place to post but I will try it. I’ve looked at the 4 options we can apply for SW but do not see the ideal option for our team: We would like a combined cloud based for those students without good PC’s, local install for CAM capabilities and those with good PC’s, but both users having access to the same cloud storage so they can all use the same files. Does this option exist?

Does SOLIDWORKS Desktop + cloud services give us these features.

I can’t figure out what the  3DEXPERIENCE Engineer part of SOLIDWORKS Desktop + 3DEXPERIENCE Engineer provides. Can anyone explain or point me the correct website that explains this? Thanks for any help.

Bohdan - Team 1099 Mentor
